greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number with same sequence of exponents in canonical prime factorization as n.
comment: a(a(n))=a(n); a(n)=2^k iff n=p^k, p prime, k>0 (A000961); if n>1 is not a prime power, then a(n) mod 6 = 0; range of values = A055932, as distinct prime factors of a(n) are consecutive: a(n)=n iff n=A055932(k) for some k;
link: Daniel Forgues, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..100000
formula: In prime factorization of n, replace least prime by 2, next least by 3, etc.
mathematica: Table[ e = Last /@ FactorInteger[n]; Product[Prime[i]^e[[i]], {i, Length[e]}], {n, 88}] (* _Ray Chandler_, Sep 23 2005 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = f = factor(n); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = prime(i)); factorback(f); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 13 2014
xref: Numbers whose prime signature is aperiodic are A329139.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 21 2002
